techmeme.title: Moment, which offers fixed income portfolio management software to financial institutions, raised a $36M Series B led by Index, taking its total funding to $56M (PYMNTS.com)
French media: French police detained Russian professional basketball player Daniil Kasatkin at the US' request due to his alleged links to a ransomware group (Daryna Antoniuk/The Record)
Recording: Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan told staff that Intel is no longer "in the top 10 semiconductor companies" and it is "too late" to catch up to Nvidia (Mike Rogoway/Oregonian)
Sources: Meta won't propose more changes to its pay-or-consent model in the EU, and could face fresh antitrust charges in the coming weeks and hefty daily fines (Foo Yun Chee/Reuters)
Goldman Sachs CTO Marco Argenti says the bank will "start augmenting our workforce with Devin", Cognition's AI software engineer, as Wall Street firms adopt AI (Hugh Son/CNBC)
